column4: Hi! This is my first time using IRC. I'm considering switching to Ubuntu. I'm willing to lean computer programming. If you don't mind talking to a total newbie, do any of you have words of wisdom for me?
What does "port" mean? (Sorry, I'm such a beginner! I promise I learn quickly.)
port for networking in and out of the computer
What if it's not compatible with something i want to use, or doesn't run well enough with my computer's hardware?
their are over 65000 ports on the computer
65000? Why so many? I get the basics like your email goes out one port, or you could specify another....
Thanks crimsonmane. It'll be nice to use it without hassle. But, I really am planning on learning how to program, and dealing with Linux would be as good a place to start as any.
I'd love to be able to tweak things.
Also, I'm done tolerating the glitches Windows gives me. I want the ability to get my hands around a problem until I've strangled it.
But with Linux, can't you get in there and manually fix the glitches?
Parsnip, thank you, Crimsonmane, what's the significance of ports?
